turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: You too big.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: Keep pushing.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: Debo!  Debo!

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: I can't feel my legs no more.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: Me neither.  How far is Rancho Cucamonga?

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: Ezal!  Ezal!

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: We must be here 'cause we stopped.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: Good, let's get out.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: Hey, how you get out of here.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I thought you were taking me to see Mama?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: I'll take you later.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: When?  After you get all drunk and loaded?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Hey!  I said I'll take your fuckin' ass later.  Now get out of here.  You're scaring our company.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Hey, what's going on?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Nothing.  What you want?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Are you going to take me to see Mom?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Take your car.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: 'Take your car?'

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Yeah, and hurry up.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Make sure you look after my son out here. Don't get him involved with none of your bullshit, Roy.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Don't worry 'bout nothin', big bro.  He in the best fuckin' hands in Rancho Chocomunga, baby!  This my world, you just a nigga late paying rent.  Ain't that right, nephew?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: I got your message.  Where's Craig?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: I don't know, I didn't leave you no damn message!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: You didn't call the Sandwich Joint with a urgent message?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Hell naw, Willie. Them fleas and tics must be sucking on yo' brain!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Somebody left me a message.  Well where's Craig and Day-Day?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: I don't know.  Suga, go ask Miss Ho Kym if she seen them.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: You come way out here to get into more trouble.  You could've stayed at home.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Willie, shut up.  Yo' old ass need to get in a little bit o' trouble sometimes.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Don't get it twisted, Elroy.  I ain't lost none of my street skills.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: What about that ugly dog?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: I got my mase.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Need to lose some weight.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Shut yo' ass up.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Damn, big bro.  You swung that like Sammy Sosa.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: The skills are still intact.  Now tie his ass up, Elroy.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: My back.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: I slip my disc, again... Oh got damn.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Well, we better hit the road, too. Craig, get your stuff.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Well, Craig, you're welcome anytime.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Craig, I want you to meet my old lady, Suga.  Suga, this is Craig.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Oooh, ba-by!

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Okay, okay, that's enough.  Go put on some damn clothes.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Elroy.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Suga.  Go ahead and get us something to smoke on.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Okay.  Bye, Craig.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: What you doing to my nephew?

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Ah, baby...I thought this was you.  Craig, what are you doing to me?

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Mr. Nasty time?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Mr. Nasty time.  But take it easy on me, girl.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Craig, you ain't the only lightweight around here.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Elroy, what happen?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: I threw my back, again.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Aw, no lovin' tonight?

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Naw, baby, no lovin' tonight.

turns.speaker: SUGA
turns.text: Come on, baby, let's go in the house.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: For what?  We ain't gonna have no house after the auction tomorrow!

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Lousy. And I have siesta hair. I'm thinking of canceling the speech.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: It's an important speech.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: During a campaign every speech is important. This is free media exposure. Primetime news coverage that we couldn't buy.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: What's he doing here?

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: Who, him? Just visiting.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Don't remind me.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: What happened here?

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Nothing. I broke a lamp.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Truth is, besides the headache I've come down with a little lower intestinal havoc. Make my apologies.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: Come on, El, you're a trooper. I'll get you some Pepto, you'll make one of your patented tributes to the common person, then back to Sacramento. This is no time to lay down on the job. I don't care what the polls say, you can't afford to relax. Look what happened to Bush. Tell you what, if you want to blow off the Sacramento speech, fine. But do this one and we'll get out of the smog.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: All right, I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: That's my girl.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: But I want to make some changes. Get Krista in here right away won't you?

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: Aw, gee. I sent her on an errand.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: You sent my assistant on an errand.

turns.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
turns.text: I've been a bad boy.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Where to, sir?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: The Bonaventure. The Bonaventure Hotel. Do you know where that is?

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Amtrack?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: You just come in on Amtrack?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Uh, yes..

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Business or pleasure?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Business.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Where'd you come from?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: San Diego.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Oh, San Diego? I've thought about moving to San Diego.  It's hard to make a living in this town. These short hops.  Can't make a dime on 'em. To LAX, Pasadena, then I can make a buck. These little hops cost me money.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: 'S okay. What do you think?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Better in San Diego? More opportunity there? What?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I really don't know. I don't live there. I was just visiting...a grave.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Aw, too bad.

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Somebody close?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: The grave. Somebody close?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Look...I've... I've got a problem. A big problem...

turns.speaker: CABBIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I need your help.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: What can I do for you Mr....Watson?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Its'...ah...about my daughter....

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: You were saying?  Your daughter....?

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: She ..ahh...wanted me to... be sure to get your autograph.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Of course.  I wish everything were that easy.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Mrs. Grant, Governor...I won't hurt you.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: My security people are right next door.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I appreciate that.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: One loud scream will bring them in here instantly. You won't get very far. Think it over.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: If I were here to hurt you I would have done it already.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: That's...a comfort to hear.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I have a problem.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Only you can help me. I'm also sorry to say, my problem is your problem, Mrs. Grant.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I remember you...in the elevator.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: You were very nervous.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: It was because I had this...in my pocket

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I saw her die. She was shot. With this gun.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: You shot her?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Who did?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I don't know. The only thing I know about him is that he works for your husband.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: And your husband works for somebody else.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: What the hell are you saying?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I knew you wouldn't believe me.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I said I'd listen to you, not necessarily believe you. You're telling me my people are in a plot against me. You're telling me my husband wants me killed. What do you expect?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: There's only one way to find out for sure. Try to cancel the last speech.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I'd prefer we didn't refer to it as my last speech.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: It's the last chance they have for me to kill you. Try to get out of it. They won't let you. They can't. Try to change the schedule and you'll know I'm right. What have you got to lose? It comes down to who you trust, them or me? Test them.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I love it when pistolero's talk of trust.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: This? I've never even fired one.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I...1 would like to...thank you, Mister Wat... Gene.

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: I would also like to apologize.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: For not believing you.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Believe me, I don't blame you.  This is the Governor, Lynn. Say hello.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Can we go now?

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Of course. I'll get a car to drive you.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No, that's... That's OK. We don't need any help. We'll be just fine. Won't we, Lynn?

turns.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Same to you.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Could I see some identification, sir?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Is this about those kids? Look, I'm sorry about that. But they darn near...

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You're from Santa Maria, Mr. Watson?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Come with us, sir.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'd like to know what...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Hey! I'll take the girl. I'll take the girl!

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Don't worry. She's good with kids.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Daddy?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes. It's OK, Lynn. These are our friends.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Pay attention, Mr. Watson. Pay attention and your daughter won't be hurt.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You wouldn't...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes, yes, I understand.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: This is for you. In it there is a picture of a woman and an itinerary. It is her itinerary. She is presently - are you listening, Mr. Watson?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes, I'm listening.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: She is presently at the Bonaventure Hotel. That's right near here.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You're out of your mind.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: What's your point?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I will do no such thing.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Yes, you will, Mr. Watson.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Look at your watch. Look at it! At one-thirty your little girl is dead. Say it with me. At one-thirty my little girl is dead. Say it. Say it!

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: At one thirty my little girl is dead.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Unless you do what you're told. Go do it!

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: This says "invitation only".

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Of course you're invited. You're a big donor to the campaign. They love you.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: This'11 get you in anywhere.  Red Elevator. Thirty-fifth floor.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Where did you get these? Who are you?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: I'm the guy who's going to kill your daughter if you don't get moving.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Are you 'fucking with me!?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: The gun...

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: What about the gun?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: It wasn't loaded. I didn't put the bullets in it.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You...

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You get another chance in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Then I have time for a drink.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What would you do in my place?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Tell me why I miss him.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: He's dead?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: That's right. He's dead. Tell me why.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: How should I...?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Tell me why he's dead.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You killed him.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: That's right, I killed him. He fucked up one too many times so I put a bullet in his eye. Then I put two more into him just to make sure. Now that was somebody I loved.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I killed you.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You fucked up.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'm not stupid.. I know how this is supposed, to work.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Do you now, Mr. Watson?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I kill her - and you kill me.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Keep your voice down.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Even if you don't, Her Security men will.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: How am I supposed to get away?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: That's not my problem, Mr. Watson

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Come back.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: How do I know you won't kill my daughter once I'm gone?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Again.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No, please...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: One thirty. California Ballroom.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: That's right. That gives you...

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: ...twenty-six minutes to get your shit together.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Let me talk to her again.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I want'to talk to her.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Forget about it.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I talk to her or you can forget about it.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Don't you threaten me.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What are you going to do about it, shoot me?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You know what I'm gonna do.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What? Walk out there and twist her arm off?

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: Is that something precious?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No, that's,..that's fine

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: My wife always said I had a problem trusting people.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: Well, you can trust Eleanor Samara Grant.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You don't understand. I'm going to trust you. And you have to trust me.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: Yes, you're right, I don't understand.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Look...my daughter ... she's going to die...unless you can help me.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: All right, let's just...let's get security in on this.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No! You can't! They're in on it.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I don't see how they could be in on it. They're the best. They're hand- picked.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You've got to trust me. I'm putting my daughter's life in your hands. She's only six. She's just a little girl. Please, please, trust me.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: It's a little hard to trust you under the circumstances.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: The man following me has a walkie- talkie. If he sees I'm not here he'll call his partner. I do anything out of line and he'll send the word to kill my daughter.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: He'll think you're in the crowd until the end of the speech. Wait a minute.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I've heard this speech a lot. Come on. We'll take care of him.  We will.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: Trust me. You asked me for help. Let me help. Trust me.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I think you better put that away.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I think you're right.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Who is this? Are you sure we can trust him?

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I'm sure. It's her husband. He's her Campaign Manager.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: We have to hurry.

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: I know. Brendan, listen to me. Someone is trying to kill Eleanor.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'm serious, honey. Don't get out of my sight, all right? I want you to stay right by me. Will you do that for me?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Nods solemnly. GENE reaches the platform and gives out an exaggerated sigh.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: We made it.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Haven't you ever seen anybody kiss like that?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: On TV.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You never saw your Mom and me kiss like that?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: So, come on. You never saw us kiss like that?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: How did you see us kiss?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Nods.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Let' s do it.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Now, see, this is why you should always wear a helmet and knee pads. You never know when you're going to fall down and go boom. Right?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Lynn!

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I can hear you good. Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes. Yes, I can hear you.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: He has to say "over and out". Daddy, you have to say "over and out".

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Over and out.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes, sweetie, it's me.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I'm tired. I want to.go now.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I know you do, honey.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Can we go now?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Not just yet, baby. There's...there's something Daddy has to do.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: To be a hero?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No, honey, not to be a hero. But I want you to remember something for me, all right?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: He's doing it for you. No matter what anybody tells you, no matter who they are, he's doing it for you, because he loves you.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Will you promise me that?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: All right. Kisses to you.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: No...kisses to you.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No. Kisses to you.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: No, kisses to...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What do you do, if I may be so bold?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'm just an accountant.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Don't denigrate yourself, my friend. Where would the government be without accountants?  They wouldn't know how hard they can squeeze us before we pop, isn't that right?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I have to do something.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What's that? You have to speak up.  I'm a little deaf in this ear. Between that and my wooden leg I'm a mess. Compliments of the United States Army Artillery Corps.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I said I have to do something.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I'll have you out of here in two shakes o'f a lamb's tail.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Is within himself.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You got anything smaller?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Keep it.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: It's a twenty.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Keep it.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Can I get out to Flower Street from here?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Sure. Go down past the bar. Take you right out there.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You remember me?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I remember. The big tipper.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Something is going to happen. When it's over you'll know what I was talking about.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Oh, man...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Please. Something is going to happen...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What? The end of the world? Man, don't give me your mad rap. I'm not a bartender. I don't want to hear it. I raise a family doing this bullshit. Do me a favor. Get your crazy white ass out of my chair.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Hey, a big tip doesn't give you the right to crap in my ear. You want change?  You got it, brother. What was that you gave me, a twenty?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Mister, what are you dragging me into?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'm not dragging you into anything. I don't expect...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Cover your mouth.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: This gorilla's watching you, is that right?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Then don't let him be seeing you talking to me. I don't want him twisting my arm off.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: My daughter. They have her in a van across the street. They say they'll kill her if I don't do something for them.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: In twenty-five minutes in the California Ballroom.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: There was a woman. She was trying to help me. I watched him murder her.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What are you supposed to do?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Kill the Governor.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I knew I should have packed up and gone home as soon as I got that twenty. What am I supposed to do about this situation?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: One of them is in on it. He might even be in charge. Her Security is in on it. There's only one person I know for sure isn't in on it.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: The Governor. If I could just talk to her...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus ...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No way, there's nothing you can do to help me.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Then why'd you drag me into it?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: It's my kid. I've got to...to somehow...do right by my little girl.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: It's about time I did. I was one of those guys, workaholics. I worked my ass off for them - my wife, my daughter.  That's just what I thought I was supposed to do.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah, all right, listen...

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: So when she wanted a divorce...I was...I didn't know what I'd done wrong. I didn't see it. I didn't see it....

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Why don't you tell me about the early years some other time?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I'm sorry. You understand I don't mind dying if I could save my daughter. I mean that.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah, now listen.  I can't mess with these shoes any more or it's gonna look funny. You go down get yourself something to drink. Make sure Godzilla there, follows you.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What are you going to do?
